intro: Exocarpos pseudocasuarina, commonly known as the slender hakea, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruits are woody, follicles that split open to release seeds. It is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments.
